sen.j: 京都縦貫自動車道（きょうとじゅうかんじどうしゃどう）は、起点を京都府久世郡久御山町、終点を同府宮津市とする延長約100kmの高規格幹線道路（一般国道478号）である。
sen.e: Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado Expressway, which is approximately 1000 km long, is an arterial high-standard highway (National Highway 478) extending from Kumiyama Town, Kuse-gun, Kyoto Prefecture to Miyazu City, Kyoto prefecture.

Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado Expressway, which is approximately 1000 km long, is an arterial high-standard highway (National Highway 478) extending from Kumiyama Town, Kuse-gun, Kyoto Prefecture to Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture.

Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado Expressway, which is approximately 100 km long, is an arterial high-standard highway (National Highway 478) extending from Kumiyama Town, Kuse-gun, Kyoto Prefecture to Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 南北に長い京都府内を縦貫し、府北部と南部の連携を強化、地域の活性化を図ると共に、高規格道路網の脆弱な京都市都市圏の南部外環状道路としての役割を果たしている。
sen.e: The expressway runs through long and narrow Kyoto Prefecture from north to south, contributes to an enhanced regional cooperation between north and south and the promotion of regional activation, and acts as a belt line in southern urban areas of Kyoto City having inadequate high standard road networks

The expressway runs through the long, narrow Kyoto Prefecture from north to south, contributing to enhanced regional cooperation between north and south and the promotion of regional activation, and acts as a belt line in the southern urban areas of Kyoto City, which otherwise lack adequate high-standard road networks.

The expressway runs through the long, narrow Kyoto Prefecture from north to south, contributing to enhanced regional cooperation between north and south and the promotion of regional activation, and acts as a belt line in the southern urban areas of Kyoto City, which otherwise lack adequate high-standard road networks.

sen.j: 京都府知事は「京都の背骨」と言って本道路を表現する。
sen.e: Kyoto Governor describes this expressway as "Kyoto no Sebone", or the backbone of Kyoto.
Kyoto Governor describes this expressway as "Kyoto no Sebone," or the backbone of Kyoto.
Kyoto Governor describes this expressway as "Kyoto no Sebone," or the backbone of Kyoto.

sen.j: 現在のところ、起点側、中央部、終点側の3カ所が開通しており、起点側は京都縦貫自動車道ではなく京滋バイパスという名称で開業した。
sen.e: Until now, 3 sections have opened in 3 different areas; on the side of the starting point, around the middle, and on the side of the terminal. The section on the side of the staring point has opened under the name of not Jukan Jidoshado Expressway but Keiji Bypass.

Until now, three sections have opened in three different areas: on the side of the starting point, around the middle, and on the side of the terminal. The section on the side of the staring point has opened under the name "Keiji Bypass" instead of "Jukan Jidoshado Expressway."

Until now, three sections have opened in three different areas: on the side of the starting point, around the middle, and on the side of the terminal. The section on the side of the staring point has opened under the name "Keiji Bypass" instead of "Jukan Jidoshado Expressway."

sen.j: また、一般には京都丹波道路のみを指して京都縦貫自動車道と言う場合も多い。
sen.e: When people say "Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado Expressway", many may refer only to the Kyoto Tanba Road.
When people say "Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado Expressway," many may be referring only to the Kyoto Tanba Road.
When people say "Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado Expressway," many may be referring only to the Kyoto Tanba Road.

sen.j: 宮津天橋立IC側の本線部分はここで終点とならず、地域高規格道路鳥取豊岡宮津自動車道として、鳥取自動車道、山陰自動車道の鳥取ICまで延伸する予定である。
sen.e: Its roadway will not end at the Miyazu-Amanohashidate Interchange, but will extends to the Tottori Jidoshado Expressway and the Tottori Interchange of the Sanin Jidoshado Expressway as a local high-standard highway, the Tottori Tomioka Miyazu Jidosha Expressway.

Its roadway will not end at the Miyazu-Amanohashidate Interchange but will extend to the Tottori Jidoshado Expressway and the Tottori Interchange of the Sanin Jidoshado Expressway as a local high-standard highway, being the Tottori Tomioka Miyazu Jidosha Expressway.

Its roadway will not end at the Miyazu-Amanohashidate Interchange but will extend to the Tottori Jidoshado Expressway and the Tottori Interchange of the Sanin Jidoshado Expressway as a local high-standard highway, being the Tottori Toyoka Miyazu Jidosha Expressway.

sen.j: なお、久御山淀IC～大山崎JCT/ICの区間は高速自動車国道なので最低速度が適用され、小特などの通行は不可能である。
sen.e: The section between the Kumiyamayodo Interchange and the Oyamaza Junction/Interchange is an national expressway, where a minimum speed limit is enforced, and thus small and compact vehicles.are banned.

The section between the Kumiyamayodo Interchange and the Oyamaza Junction/Interchange is a national expressway on which a minimum speed limit is enforced; consequently, small and compact vehicles are prohibited.

The section between the Kumiyamayodo Interchange and the Oyamazaki Junction/Interchange is a national expressway on which a minimum speed limit is enforced; consequently, small and compact vehicles are prohibited.
sen.cmt: スペルミススペース取る

sen.j: 綾部宮津道路の宮津天橋立IC及び舞鶴大江ICにETCは設置されていないが、2008年度中に西日本高速道路により、開通予定の京丹波わちICも含めてETCが設置される予定である。
sen.e: The ETC (Electronic Toll Collection) system has not been introduced in the Miyazu-Amanohashidate Interchange and the Ayabe Miyatsu Road, but West Nippon Expressway Company limited will start the service in the fiscal year 2008 at interchanges including the Kyotanba-wachi Interchange to be opened then.

The ETC (Electronic Toll Collection) system has not been introduced in the Miyazu-Amanohashidate Interchange or the Ayabe Miyatsu Road, but West Nippon Expressway Company, Ltd., was scheduled to start service in fiscal year 2008 at interchanges including the Kyotanba-wachi Interchange, which would then be opened.

The ETC (Electronic Toll Collection) system has not been introduced at the Miyazu-Amanohashidate or Maizuru–Oe Interchanges of Ayabe Miyatsu Road,, but West Nippon Expressway Company, Ltd., was scheduled to start the ETC service in fiscal year 2008 at interchanges including the Kyotanba-wachi Interchange, which would then be opened.

sen.j: このため、現在は宮津天橋立IC及び舞鶴大江ICにETC設置工事が行われており、
sen.e: So the equipment for ETC is being installed at Miyazu-Amanohashidate Interchange now and the Miyazu-A,ampjasjodate Interchange of the Ayabe Miyatsu Road
Accordingly, the equipment for ETC is now being installed at Miyazu-Amanohashidate Interchange, as well as at the Miyazu-A,ampjasjodate Interchange of the Ayabe Miyatsu Road,
Accordingly, the equipment for ETC is now being installed at the Miyazu-Amanohashidate Interchange, as well as at the Maizuru-oe Interchange of the Ayabe Miyatsu Road,

sen.j: 幅2.5mを越える特殊車両が通行不可能となっている。
sen.e: and special purpose vehicle with a width exceeding 2.5m are banned from the road.
and special-purpose vehicles exceeding 2.5m in width are banned from the road.
and special-purpose vehicles exceeding 2.5 m in width are banned from the road.

Toll Road Section and Toll-Free Section

sen.j: 有料道路区間 （綾部宮津道路は京都府道路公社、その他は西日本高速道路管理）
sen.e: Toll Road Sections (The Ayabe Miyatsu Road is operated by Kyoto Prefectural Road Public Corporation and others are operated by West Nippon Expressway Corporation Limited.)

Toll road sections (the Ayabe Miyatsu Road is operated by Kyoto Prefectural Road Public Corporation and others are operated by West Nippon Expressway Corporation Limited)

Kutsukake IC - Tanba IC (Kyoto Tanba Road)
Kutsukake IC - Tanba IC (Kyoto Tanba Road)

Ayabe JCT - Miyaza IC (Ayabe Miyazu Road)

Toll-Free Sections

sen.j: 綾部安国寺IC～綾部JCT（丹波綾部道路）
sen.e: Ayabe-Ankokuji IC - Ayabe JCT (Tanba Ayabe Road)
Ayabe-Ankokuji IC - Ayabe JCT (Tanba Ayabe Road)
Ayabe-Ankokuji IC - Ayabe JCT (Tanba Ayabe Road)

sen.j: 現在、綾部北本線料金所（綾部JCT）と綾部安国寺IC間に出口はなく、無料区間だけを走ることはできない。
sen.e: Now there is no exit between the Ayabekita Tollgate (Ayabe Junction) and the Ayabe Ankokuji Tollgate, so drivers are not allowed to run only toll-free sections.
Now there is no exit between the Ayabekita Tollgate (Ayabe Junction) and the Ayabe Ankokuji Tollgate, so drivers aren't allowed to run only toll-free sections.
Now there is no exit between the Ayabekita Tollgate (Ayabe Junction) and the Ayabe Ankokuji Tollgate, so drivers aren't allowed to run only toll-free sections.

sen.j: 2008年夏～秋頃に開通予定の京丹波わちIC～綾部安国寺は、京都府道路公社の管理となる予定であり、その際に同時に綾部安国寺IC～綾部JCTも京都府道路公社の管理となる予定の為、現在無料区間となっている綾部安国寺IC～綾部JCTも、有料化される予定である。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Road Public Corporation will operate the section between the Kyotanbawa-wachi Interchange and the Ayabe Ankokuji Interchange to be opened in summer to autumn, 2008, when the Corporation will take the responsiblity of the section between the Ayabe Ankokuji Interchange and the Ayabe Junction and On this occasion, the current toll-free section will become a toll road.

Kyoto Prefectural Road Public Corporation will operate the section between the Kyotanbawa-wachi Interchange and the Ayabe Ankokuji Interchange, as scheduled to open in the period from summer to autumn of 2008, when the Corporation will take responsibility for the section between the Ayabe Ankokuji Interchange and the Ayabe Junction, and on this occasion the current toll-free section will become a toll road.

The Kyoto Prefectural Road Public Corporation will operate the section between the Kyotanba-wachi Interchange and the Ayabe Ankokuji Interchange, which was scheduled to open in the period from summer to autumn of 2008, when the Corporation would take responsibility for the section between the Ayabe Ankokuji Interchange and the Ayabe Junction, and on this occasion the current toll-free section would become a toll road.

sen.j: それに合わせ、現在の綾部北本線料金所（綾部JCT）は撤去され、綾部安国寺料金所が新設される。
sen.e: As the result, the current Ayabekita toll barrier (Ayabe Junction) will be replaced by the Ayabe Ankokuji Tollbooth.
Consequently, the current Ayabekita toll barrier (Ayabe Junction) will be replaced by the Ayabe Ankokuji Tollbooth.
Consequently, the current Ayabekita toll barrier (Ayabe Junction) will be replaced by the Ayabe Ankokuji Tollbooth.

sen.j: （現在の綾部安国寺ICは料金所が無い）これにより、綾部宮津道路では本線上の料金所は無くなる。
sen.e: (The Ayabe Ankokuji Interchange has no tollbooth now) but when the new tollbooth is built at the interchange, the current barrier gate will be removed..
(The Ayabe Ankokuji Interchange has no tollbooth, but when the new tollbooth is built at the interchange the current barrier gate will be removed.)
(The Ayabe Ankokuji Interchange has no tollbooth, but when the new tollbooth is built at the interchange the current barrier gate will be removed.)

sen.j: 現在の綾部北本線料金所（綾部JCT）はプレハブの仮設に近い作りとなっている。
sen.e: The current Ayabekita Toll barrier (Ayabe Junction) is of a prefabricated structure only for a temporary use.
The current Ayabekita Toll barrier (Ayabe Junction) is of a prefabricated structure intended specifically for temporary use.
The current Ayabekita Toll barrier (Ayabe Junction) is of a prefabricated structure intended specifically for temporary use.

sen.j: 丹波IC～京丹波わちICは、現在のところ国土交通省にて事業が進行中で2014年度に開通予定となっているが、開通後の管理体制はまだ不明である。
sen.e: A project for the construction of the section between the Tanba Interchange and the Kyotanbawachi Interchange is being promoted by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism for the opening in 2014, but who will operate it is not unknown.

A project for the construction of the section between the Tanba and Kyotanbawachi interchanges is being promoted by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism for opening in 2014, but to date the operator has not been indicated.

A project for the construction of the section between the Tanba and Kyotanba-wachi interchanges is being promoted by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism for opening in 2014, but to date the operator has not been indicated.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1988年2月17日：一般国道9号老ノ坂亀岡道路（沓掛IC～亀岡IC）が一般有料道路、一般国道9号亀岡道路（亀岡IC～千代川IC）が暫定無料の道路として開通。
sen.e: February 17, 1988: Opening of the National Highway 9 Oinosaka-Kameoka Road (Kutsukake IC - Chiyokawa IC) as a toll road, and the National Highway 9 Kameoka Road (Kameoka IC - Chiyokawa IC) as a temporarily toll-free road

February 17, 1988: Opening of the National Highway 9 Oinosaka-Kameoka Road (Kutsukake IC - Chiyokawa IC) as a toll road, and the National Highway 9 Kameoka Road (Kameoka IC - Chiyokawa IC) as a temporarily toll-free road

February 17, 1988: Opening of the National Highway 9 Oinosaka-Kameoka Road (Kutsukake IC - Kameoka IC) as a toll road, and the National Highway 9 Kameoka Road (Kameoka IC - Chiyokawa IC) as a temporarily toll-free road.

sen.j: 1993年5月6日：沓掛IC～千代川ICが国道9号から一般国道478号に変更される。

May 6, 1993: The designation of National Highway 9 was changed to National Highway 478, Kutsukake IC - Chiyokawa IC.
May 6, 1993: The designation of National Highway 9 was changed to National Highway 478, Kutsukake IC - Chiyokawa IC.

sen.j: 1993年9月9日：亀岡IC～千代川ICが一般有料道路として営業開始。
sen.e: September 9, 1993: Start of toll road service of the Kameoka IC - Chiyokawa IC section

September 9, 1993: Toll-road service started on the Kameoka IC - Chiyokawa IC section.

sen.j: 1996年4月27日：千代川IC～丹波IC（八木園部道路）開通。
sen.e: April 27, 1996: Opening of the Chiyokawa IC - Tanba IC section (Yagi-sonobe Road)
On April 27, 1996 the Chiyokawa IC - Tanba IC section (Yagi-sonobe Road) opened.
April 27, 1996: The Chiyokawa IC - Tanba IC section (Yagi-sonobe Road) opened.

sen.j: 1998年3月8日：綾部JCT～舞鶴大江IC開通により舞鶴自動車道（現：舞鶴若狭自動車道）と接続（暫定2車線の対面通行）。
sen.e: March 8, 1998: Connection to the Maizuru Expressway (present Maizuru wakasa Expressway) through the opening of the Ayabe Junction - Maizuru-oe Junction (temporary two- lane, two-way traffic)

On March 8, 1998 a connection was established to the Maizuru Expressway (the present Maizuru Wakasa Expressway) through the opening of the Ayabe Junction - Maizuru-oe Junction (temporary two-lane, two-way traffic).

March 8, 1998: A connection was established to the Maizuru Expressway (the present Maizuru Wakasa Expressway) through the opening of the Ayabe Junction - Maizuru-oe Interchange (temporary two-lane, two-way traffic).
sen.cmt: 用語ミス年表形式に統一しました。

sen.j: 2003年3月2日：舞鶴大江IC～宮津天橋立IC開通（暫定2車線の対面通行）。
sen.e: March 2, 2003: Opening of the Maizuru-oe IC - Miyazu-amadate IC (temporary two- lane, two-way traffic)
On March 2, 2003 the Maizuru-oe IC - Miyazu-amadate IC (temporary two-lane, two-way traffic) was opened.
March 2, 2003: The Maizuru-oe IC - Miyazu-amanohashidate IC (temporary two-lane, two-way traffic) was opened.

sen.j: 2003年3月27日：綾部安国寺IC～綾部JCT開通（暫定2車線の対面通行）。
sen.e: March 27, 2003: Opening of the Ayabe Ankokuji IC - Ayabe JCT (temporary two- lane, two-way traffic)

March 27, 2003: The Ayabe Ankokuji IC - Ayabe JCT (temporary two-lane, two-way traffic) was opened.

sen.j: 2003年12月24日：大山崎IC開通。
sen.e: December 24, 2003: Opening of the Oyamazaki IC
On December 24, 2003 the Oyamazaki IC opened.
December 24, 2003: The Oyamazaki IC opened.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に統一しました。

sen.j: 2005年10月1日：道路関係四公団の民営化により、保有を独立行政法人日本高速道路保有・債務返済機構に、管理を西日本高速道路株式会社に移管。
sen.e: October 1, 2005: Transfer of the ownership to Japan Expressway Holding and Dept Repayment and Agency Privatization of 4 Highway Public Corporations, and the management to West Nippon Expressway Company Limited

On October 1, 2005 the transfer of ownership to Japan Expressway Holding and the Debt Repayment and Agency Privatization of Four Highway Public Corporations took place, and the management was tranferred to West Nippon Expressway Company Limited
sen.cmt: Is "Debt... Corporations" part of an official arrangement name?
sen.e: On October 1, 2005: Due to the Privatization of Four Highway Public Corporations the transfer of ownership to Japan Expressway Holding and the Debt Repayment and Agency took place, and the management was tranferred to West Nippon Expressway Company Limited
sen.cmt: 「道路関係四公団の民営化により」の部分の訳を修正しました。年表形式に統一しました。

List of Interchanges and Facilities

sen.j: IC番号欄の背景色が■である部分については道路が供用済みの区間を示している。
sen.e: Sections having Interchanges with a highlight in ■ have been made available.
Sections having interchanges with a highlight in ■ have been made available.
Sections having interchanges with a highlight in green have been made available.

sen.j: また、施設名欄の背景色が■である部分は施設が供用されていない、または完成していないことを示す。
sen.e: The facilities with a highlight in ■ have not been established or completed.
The facilities with a highlight in ■ have not been established or completed.
The facilities with a highlight in ash have not been established or completed.

sen.j: 未開通区間の名称は仮称。
sen.e: Tentative names are used for the sections yet to be opened.
Tentative names are used for the sections that haven't yet opened.
Tentative names are used for the sections that haven't yet opened.

sen.j: BS（バス停留所）のうち、○/●は運用中、◆は休止中の施設。
sen.e: BS (bus stop) with symbols ○/● is for buses in service and with ◆ for buses out of service.
BS (bus stop) with symbols ○/● is used for buses that are in service and ◆ is used for buses that are out of service.
BS (bus stop) with symbols ○/● is used for buses that are in service and ◆ is used for buses that are out of service.

sen.j: 無印はBSなし。
sen.e: No symbol means bus stops are not available.
The absence of a symbol means bus stops aren't available.
The absence of a symbol means bus stops aren't available.

sen.j: （数字）は、他路線の番号。
sen.e: Numbers in parentheses are for interchanges of other expressways.
Numbers in parentheses are for the interchanges of other expressways.
Numbers in parentheses are for the interchanges of other expressways.

sen.j: <数字>は、予定番号。
sen.e: Numbers in angle parentheses are for interchanges to be set.
Numbers in angular parentheses are for the interchanges yet to be set.
Numbers in angular parentheses are for the interchanges yet to be set.

sen.j: （導入実験中のスマートインターチェンジが設置されているSAPAは、斜体 で示す。また、恒久化されたスマートICは、スマートICで示す。）
sen.e: (SAPA having a smart interchange set on a trial basis is in italic. Smart IC refers to smart interchanges that have been set on a permanent basis.)
